alert.note: Alert for Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 9:34PM CDT until May 18 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Humble...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Fork San Jacinto near Humble. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 50.3 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins as homes on Lake Point Drive in the Northshore subdivision begin flooding and roads in the Bellaeu Woods subdivision are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 50.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM CDT Tuesday was 50.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 50.8 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 49.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 50.7 feet on 05/08/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri West Fork San Jacinto Humble 49.3 50.3 Tue 5 am CDT 49.9 48.3 47.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 345 PM CDT.
